intro: Odontites jaubertianus subsp. jaubertianus, commonly known as the Jaubert's toothed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing tiny, greenish to brownish flowers that are wind-pollinated. Odontites jaubertianus subsp. jaubertianus is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and its role in alpine ecosystems.
